intro: Lagenandra erosa, commonly known as the slender lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Verrucariaceae. It is characterized by its crustose growth form, forming a thin, flat layer on the surfaces of rocks and tree bark. The thallus is typically pale green to yellowish in color, and it lacks distinct lobes or pores. It is often found in moist, shaded environments, particularly in temperate regions. Lagenandra erosa plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms.
